metadata.name: Potential Encoded PowerShell Patterns In CommandLine
metadata.comment: Detects specific combinations of encoding methods in PowerShell via the commandline

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (lower(activity_id) = lower('1') AND (endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\powershell.exe')) OR endswith(lower(process.name), lower('\\pwsh.exe'))) AND (lower(LOWER(process.file.name)) in ('powershell\.exe', 'pwsh\.dll')) AND ((contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('toint')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('todecimal')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('tobyte')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('touint')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('tosingle')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('tosbyte'))) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('tochar')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('tostring')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('string'))) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('char')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('join')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('split')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('join'))))

output.summary: Detects specific combinations of encoding methods in PowerShell via the commandline
